indication: Atrial fibrillation, evaluate for left atrial appendage thrombus prior to consideration of cardioversion
technique: Standard transesophageal echocardiographic examination was performed using a multiplane transesophageal probe after adequate sedation and topical pharyngeal anesthesia. The patient tolerated the procedure well.

sedation.monitoring: Continuous pulse oximetry and cardiac monitoring

leftAtrium.appendage: Left atrial appendage is dilated. No thrombus identified. LAA emptying velocity 28 cm/s (reduced, consistent with atrial fibrillation).
leftAtrium.spontaneousEchoContrast: Mild spontaneous echo contrast ('smoke') present in the left atrium, consistent with low flow state in atrial fibrillation.

findings.interatrialSeptum: No patent foramen ovale or atrial septal defect identified by color flow or agitated saline contrast injection.
findings.leftVentricle: Moderately dilated. Estimated EF 30-35%. Global hypokinesis. Inferior and inferolateral wall akinesis.
findings.rightSide: Right atrium mildly dilated. Right ventricle normal size with mildly reduced function.
findings.mitralValve: Moderate mitral regurgitation (3+). Leaflets are mildly thickened. No prolapse. No stenosis.
findings.aorticValve: Trileaflet. Mild sclerosis without stenosis. Trace aortic regurgitation.
findings.tricuspidValve: Mild tricuspid regurgitation. Estimated RVSP 42 mmHg.

aorta.descendingAorta: Mild atherosclerotic plaque in the descending thoracic aorta. No mobile atheroma.

impression: No left atrial appendage thrombus identified. Mild spontaneous echo contrast present.
Severely dilated left atrium with reduced LAA emptying velocities.
Moderately reduced left ventricular systolic function (EF 30-35%) with regional wall motion abnormalities.
Mild descending thoracic aortic atherosclerosis without mobile atheroma.
From a TEE standpoint, cardioversion can be considered if clinically indicated.
recommendations: If cardioversion attempted, maintain therapeutic anticoagulation for at least 4 weeks post-procedure
comparison: TEE dated 2019-03-29. Stable LV function. LAA remains free of thrombus.
